newsitem.title: USA: Calif. urged to give counties, cities tax relief.
newsitem.headline: Calif. urged to give counties, cities tax relief.

text.p: California's legislature should provide at least $100 million in property tax shift relief to local governments in the 1997-1998 budget, the state's legislative analyst said in a report on Wednesday.
The tax shifts, commonly referred to as "ERAF" or the Educational Revenue Augmentation Fund, were enacted during fiscal years 1992-1993 and 1993-1994.
Facing its own budget crisis, the state permanently redirected over $3 billion of property taxes from local governments to schools and community colleges.
